summary: This document is a compilation of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, NY, covering June 30, 2019, through August 11, 2019. The logs detail routine operations, inmate counts, medical and psychiatric observations, transfers, and facility maintenance issues. The most significant entry documents the medical emergency and subsequent death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on the morning of August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054. Documented on suicide watch, psych observation, and in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). Found unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019; CPR was performed, and he was transported to a local hospital where he was later pronounced dead.

persons.name: Lt. G.
persons.context: A lieutenant who frequently assumes duties as the Morning Watch (M/W) Operations Lieutenant. Logs numerous shifts and is on duty the morning Epstein is found unresponsive.

persons.name: Lt. S.
persons.context: A lieutenant who assumes duties across all shifts (Morning, Day, Evening Watch). Logs many operational details and is the relieving lieutenant noted during the Epstein medical emergency.

persons.name: Lt. J.
persons.context: A lieutenant who frequently assumes duties as the Day Watch (D/W) Operations Lieutenant. Logs daily census counts and inmate movements.

persons.name: Lt. D.
persons.context: A lieutenant who assumes duties on Evening and Morning Watches. Logs inmate transfers and counts.

persons.name: Lt. C.
persons.context: A lieutenant who assumes duties as Day Watch Operations Lieutenant on several dates.

persons.name: Lt. M.
persons.context: A lieutenant who assumes duties on Day and Evening Watches. Serves as Acting Lieutenant on several logs.

persons.name: Captain Darden
persons.context: Mentioned in logs regarding bed space decisions in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) for inmate Hemingway.

persons.name: Cherry
persons.context: Inmate #76218-054. Frequently noted as being at a local hospital under USMS guard escort for an extended period during July 2019.

persons.name: Burnett
persons.context: Inmate #76254-054. Documented at a local hospital and later at 'Goldcrest nursing facility' under USMS guard escort for an extended period.

persons.name: Gebremariam
persons.context: Inmate #79792-007. Frequently placed on Psych Observation with an inmate companion during July 2019.

persons.name: Pecorella
persons.context: Inmate #70497-050. Frequently placed on Psych Observation with an inmate companion during early July 2019.

persons.name: Grayson
persons.context: Inmate #70887-054. Placed on suicide watch and psych observation after an 'immediate use of force' incident on July 12, 2019.

persons.name: Benjamin
persons.context: Inmate #86463-054. Placed on suicide watch, psych observation, and noted as 'pending bed space' in the SHU during August 2019.

persons.name: Manafort
persons.context: Inmate #35207-016. Mentioned once on July 17, 2019, being removed from ES to 'HLD Remove'.

connections.description: Lt. G. was the Operations Lieutenant on duty during the Morning Watch when Epstein was found unresponsive and the medical emergency was initiated.
Lt. S. was the relieving lieutenant on duty at approximately 5:30 AM on August 10, 2019, when the medical emergency for Epstein was announced and logged.
Inmate Burnett is consistently documented as being at a local hospital or nursing facility under the guard of US Marshals Service (USMS) personnel.
Inmate Cherry is consistently documented as being at a local hospital under the guard of US Marshals Service (USMS) personnel.
Captain Darden is cited as authorizing the placement of inmate Hemingway in a Housing Area (HA) due to 'No bed space on SHU'.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At approximately 6:33 AM, a medical emergency was announced for inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) found unresponsive in cell Z06-220 in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). CPR was performed, EMS was called, and he was transported to a local hospital. The log later notes a call from BOP staff regarding Epstein.

events.title: Use of Force on Inmate Grayson
events.description: At 3:20 PM, an 'immediate use of force' on inmate Grayson (#70887-054) is logged; the inmate was subsequently placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Anonymous Threat Call
events.description: At 2:15 AM, NYC 311 operator reported an anonymous call stating 'the Macballers are planning a stabbing on unit 11 south whenever the unit opens in the morning.'

events.title: Inmate Lopez on Psych Observation
events.description: At 2:45 PM, inmate Lopez (#20472-038) was placed on Psych observation 'pending bed space in special housing' after being 'incoherent and admitted to smoking K-2.'

events.title: Fight on Unit 7 South
events.description: At 9:05 PM, a call for assistance for an 'unwitnessed fight' on unit 7 South involved inmates Lans and Fuentes, resulting in Lans being taken to the hospital and Fuentes being placed in the SHU.

events.title: Attempted Assault by Inmate Cruz
events.description: At 1:30 PM, inmate Cruz (#90780-053) attempted to assault inmate Roberts (#86411-054), resulting in a unit lockdown. Cruz was later transferred to MDC Brooklyn.

events.title: FBI Commits Inmate Willey
events.description: At 11:05 PM, the FBI arrived with a new commit, inmate Willey (#76330-054), described as a 'safe keep.' He was placed on the second-floor suicide watch area due to lack of SHU bed space.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) at approximately 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019. CPR was performed, EMS transported him to a local hospital, and he was later pronounced dead.
The logs show Epstein was on suicide watch and psych observation at various times in July 2019 and was in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the time of his death.

The facility experienced recurring operational issues, including inoperative fire alarm/sprinkler systems requiring 'Fire Watches,' malfunctioning control center door panels, and public address system failures preventing PREA announcements.
Several other inmates were on extended suicide watch, psych observation, or in outside medical facilities under USMS guard (e.g., inmates Cherry, Burnett, Gebremariam).

The logs document routine but detailed prison operations: multiple daily inmate counts, body alarm tests, inmate transfers to/from court and hospital, shakedowns, and administrative detentions for various infractions.
